boardgame.name: Defenders of Gaya Mystica Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Swords & Sorcery RPG Adventures for Beginners

Publisher's blurb:

Defenders of Gaya Mystica is a game designed for children and beginners in the world of RPGs. Using only two 6-sided dice, this Zine RPG values the simplicity of its rules and the fun of its players. Fast and practical in all aspects, DGM RPG proves to be complex when it comes to interpretation: nothing can be solved with just a roll of the dice! To be successful in your actions, convince the Master that yours is the best choice for your group and for the future of Gaya Mystica. Roll the dice and gather the courage to face dangers that have never been seen before in this land of natural beauty!

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: King Tut's Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Choose from over 40 possible endings!

Crazy things are happening in Egypt! The gods are angry. The Nile River is drying up. Smoke appears on the horizon. Crocodiles attack! It’s up to you to save the world. Make the right choice and you get to rule Egypt for the rest of your life. Make the wrong choice and it will be your last.
Remember, you can’t turn back. Sorry! Once you make a choice, it can’t be changed.

boardgame.name: Desert Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I find that even though I have over 200 maps downloaded from various Patreons for use in my VTT games I still find myself needing more. Sometimes less is more, and sometimes you just need a new, different landscape. I'm fairly new to VTT map making so I figured I would offer some cheap basic maps for use by the RPG community.

boardgame.name: Mushroom / Fungi Planet
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I find that even though I have over 200 maps downloaded from various Patreons for use in my VTT games I still find myself needing more. Sometimes less is more, and sometimes you just need a new, different landscape. I'm fairly new to VTT map making so I figured I would offer some cheap basic maps for use by the RPG community.

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Escape From Minecraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're trapped inside Minecraft!

You drink the wrong potion and the next thing you know, you’re inside Minecraft! Zombies and Creepers come at you from all sides. All you want to do is get home. Or wait . . . maybe you should look around for a little while first.
Can you take the right path and escape from Minecraft?

boardgame.name: Cairn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cairn is an adventure game for one facilitator (the Warden) and at least one other player. Players act as hardened adventurers, exploring a dark, mysterious Wood filled with strange folk, hidden treasure and unspeakable monstrosities.

Based on Knave and Into The Odd, Cairn is an attempt at making Into The Odd semi-compatible with popular OSR settings like Dolmenwood. Character generation is quick and random, classless, and rely on fictional advancement rather than through XP or level mechanics. The game itself is rules-light but functional, leaving most rulings up to the Warden.

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Return to Minecraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re back inside Minecraft!

You finally get back inside the Minecraft server. Now to get some answers. Except Minecraft is a scary place, and one wrong move could be your last. Should you trust Herobrine? Take the parkour challenge? You decide.

Can you get your answers and find your way out of Minecraft?

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Minecraft The End
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re going to the End of Minecraft!

You mod your way back onto the Minecraft server. Now to get to the End to find the Creators. You need to travel to the Nether then fight the ender dragon on your way. One wrong move could kill you. One right move could give you ultimate control.

Can you stay alive and make it to the End of Minecraft?

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Trapped in a Fairy Tale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're trapped in the Fairy Tale World! With over 40 possible endings!

Your granny disappears into a closet, and you follow her. Suddenly you’re trapped in the world of fairy tales. You need to find your granny and get out of here! Should you trust the evil witch? Climb the tower? Fight the ogre? One path might be the way out. Another might be your end. Only you can decide. Oh, and not every ending is a happily ever after.
Remember, you can’t turn back. Sorry! Once you make a choice, it can’t be changed.

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Dragon vs. Unicorn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DRAGON and UNICORN are both the best!

At least that’s what they think. But when Unicorn starts talking trash, Dragon cannot back down. Or was it Dragon that started it all? Who knows? Now they need to find out who is the most epic. Whether it’s throwing a party, dancing, or shooting hoops, your choices decide who wins in this one-of-a-kind book with over 30 challenges and 25 possible endings. Play as Dragon or play as Unicorn. Finish it once and go back and make different choices for hours and hours of fun. Are you ready to find out who the best really is? Open the book and let’s get this party started!

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Alice in Wonderland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’re trapped in Wonderland! With over 30 possible endings!

There you are having a picnic, minding your own business, when a white rabbit with a pocket watch hops by. You follow him (of course) and wind up in Wonderland. But now you have choices to make. Do you try to become the new queen? Do you look for a way out? Do you free the flamingos and hedgehogs being used in the queen’s croquet game? Or do you just eat cake and tarts? The choices are yours!
Remember, you can’t turn back. Sorry! Once you make a choice, it can’t be changed.

boardgame.name: Autumn Lake Ruins RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Autumn Lake Ruins - RPG Encounter Map

30" x 30" image of a lake side set of ruined buildings with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Trapped in the 80s
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You time travel back to the 1980s! With over 30 possible endings!

You walk into a record store because it’s really cool and retro, but without realizing it, you pass through a time portal. Suddenly you’re transported back to the 1980s! Now what should you do? Should you design cool video games? Invest in Apple stock? Look up your parents? Or should you try to find your way home? After all, back in the 1980s, you don’t even have a cell phone!
Remember, you can’t turn back. Once you make a choice, it can’t be changed.

boardgame.name: Pick Your Own Quest: Medusa's Head
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Medusa’s head is delivered to your house! With over 40 possible endings!

Hermes delivers a box to your house. You open it up. Inside is a smaller box covered in duct tape. It says: MEDUSA’S HEAD. DO NOT OPEN.
There’s also a piece of paper that says you’ve been chosen as the guardian of Medusa’s head. You’re supposed to keep it safe. Sure, there are some guidelines, but you don’t want this head! You could try to burn it. Or give it to that annoying girl down the street. Maybe ask the Fates to take it away. One thing is for sure. You can’t look into its eyes. You don’t want to turn to stone! In your path are angry gods, cyclopes, and the Minotaur. If you aren’t careful, this will be your end. The choices are yours.

boardgame.name: Winter Lake Ruins RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Winter Lake Ruins - RPG Encounter Map

30" x 30" image of an icebound lakeside settlement being buried by snow drifts, with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Spine Bridge RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crafted by a cabal of morphogenic sorcerers at the behest of their diabolical masters, these twin bridges are living entities of tendon and bone grown to a massive scale.

Formed to provide passage over a lava flow in an infernal realm, these bridges provide twin choke points and are suited for defending against those that may try to cross.

There are multiple variations that move the bridges to different, less hellish climates as well as some variations without the bridges.

boardgame.name: Hellenic Ruins RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hellenic Ruins - RPG Encounter Map

36" x 24" image of a partially ruined outdoor temple on the coast with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Luxury House RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Luxury House RPG Encounter Map

24" x 24" image of a large house with outside pool, optional 1" grid.

boardgame.name: Neon Station RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Neon Station RPG Encounter Map

24" x 24" image of a neon drenched transit station with built in 1" grid.

boardgame.name: Storm Drain RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Storm Drain- RPG Encounter Map

36" x 18" image of large storm drain canal running under an overpass with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Neon Alleys RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Neon Alleys- RPG Encounter Map

32" x 18" image of winding alleys leading off from a neon lit cyberpunk street with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Nephews in Peril!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

Nephews in Peril is a collection of six new mysteries for Brindlewood Bay, plus some revised rules. The new mysteries are:


"Dead Man's Hand" by Donna Giltrap: The Mavens are playing in a charity poker tournament when a card shark from Las Vegas is shot dead in the dark!
"Lies and Dolls, or A Very Brief Tenure" by Sharang Biswas: A college history class's field-trip to a creepy doll museum in Brindlewood Bay goes pear-shaped when the professor turns up dead!
"Deadly Silent Auction" by Petra Volkhausen: A cast of eccentric characters shows up at Aubertin's Antiques to participate in a silent auction—and to view the fabled Elderwing moth—when an auctioneer dies under mysterious circumstances.
"Homecoming at Bonfire Cliff" by Calvin Johns: Bonfire Cliff has been a favorite hangout spot for high school kids in Brindlewood Bay going back decades. But this scenic spot has a dark history that's getting darker by the minute!
"Carnival Carnage" by Alicia Furness: The Carnivale Noctis is in town, and the Mavens are enjoying the sights and sounds when a young carnie is murdered. What dark secrets can be found in the Funhouse and the fortune teller's tent—and will the Mavens ever be the same after this case is solved?
"Fudge, Jury, and Executioner" by Chris Bissette: The Mavens are in the strangely anglophilic town of Faversham, just up the road from Brindlewood Bay, judging a fudge competition. When the organizer of the competition turns up dead, the Mavens are conscripted by the local constabulary to interrogate the locals and find out what happened.

boardgame.name: Rooftop Helipad RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rooftop Helipad- RPG Encounter Map

24" x 24" image of a skyscraper rooftop and helipad with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Overpass RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Overpass - RPG Encounter Map

24" x 24" image of a modern overpass road with optional square grid.

boardgame.name: Jason, the Argonauts, and the Golden Fleece: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the mighty Greek hero Jason. Along with your crew of argonauts, you are setting sail in search of the Golden Fleece. But your journey will not be easy. Sea monsters, powerful witches, and deadly beasts stand in your way. Can you survive and bring the Golden Fleece back to your kingdom? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into Jason's adventures from Greek mythology.

boardgame.name: The Trojan War: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when the gods disagree? They send the mightiest of heroes to fight a war. But which hero will you be, and who will you side with: Greece’s King Menelaus or Paris, a prince from the city of Troy? If the gods favor you, you just may survive the fighting. Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into thick of battle as the Trojan War rages on.

boardgame.name: The Quest of Theseus: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the mighty Greek hero Theseus, on a quest to prove that you are the rightful heir to Athen’s throne. But your journey is filled with danger. A giant, an evil witch, and the half-man half-bull monster known as the Minotaur stand in your way. Do you have what it takes to find your long-lost father and make him proud? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into Theseus’ adventures from Greek mythology.

boardgame.name: Olympians vs. Titans: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when the mighty god Zeus and the Titan ruler Cronus battle to reign over the world? War rages, as seas boil and mountains crumble. The sky roars with the wrath of gods. Whose side will you be on? Do you have what it takes to be victorious? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into the battle between the Olympian gods and the Titans.

boardgame.name: Perseus the Hero: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the mighty Greek hero Perseus. To save your mother you must battle Medusa, a deadly monster with snakes for hair and a gaze that could turn you to stone. You will also face magical nymphs and dangerous creatures on your journey. Do you have what it takes to survive and save your mother? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you to ancient Greece and into Perseus' adventures from Greek mythology.

boardgame.name: Hades and the Underworld: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Underworld is the land of the dead and ruled by the powerful god Hades. It is not a place where the living are welcome, but that’s where you must go. You will need to cross the River Styx and face the three-head dog Cerberus. But once you are there and reach your goal, will you be able to find your way back to the living or be trapped forever? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into deep dark depths of the Underworld.

boardgame.name: The Epic Adventures of Odysseus: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the mighty Greek hero Odysseus. The Trojan War has made you a hero. But now you must return home to your island of Ithaca. The journey back will not be easy. Deadly sea monsters, cunning witches, and giant Cyclopes stand in your way. Do you have what it takes to survive and make it back home? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into Odysseus' adventures from Greek mythology.

boardgame.name: SWADE Options: Aces High!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jump in the cockpit and start up the engines!

Early biplanes, modern fighters, spaceships, and even transforming aircrafts are waiting for brave pilots to soar the skies and dive into battle!

Aces High! is an alternative fighting system that expands on the SWADE Quick Encounters rules, and is designed to represent dogfights that maintain the meaningful details of vehicles, weapons, battle orders and types of enemy units while still playing fast and cinematic.

boardgame.name: Hercules and His 12 Labors: An Interactive Mythological Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the mighty Greek hero Hercules. As a half-god, you are stronger than mere humans. You've faced many challenges. But now you face your most difficult test yet. The goddess Hera has given you a task worthy of a god—complete the dangerous 12 labors and live forever. Can you survive and win your immortality? Full-page illustrations, interactive stories, and multiple endings transport you back to ancient Greece and into Hercules' adventures from Greek mythology.

boardgame.name: Embarcadero: Unsinkable Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Unsinkable expansion for Embarcadero introduces three all-new gameplay modules and has everything you need to add a fifth player. The individual modules can be mixed and matched in any combination.

Unsinkable Ships module: This module adds unsinkable ships to the game. These new ships provide special benefits when docked. But your benefits come at a cost because those ships cannot be sunk.

Entrepreneur Buildings module: The module adds entrepreneur buildings to the game. These new buildings each count as two different card types! They also provide all-new building bonuses.

Events module: This module adds events to the game. These events, which occur twice per game, change the game in various ways, with unique bonuses or decisions for the players to make.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: City Roofs
City Roofs 4K
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #8)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue #8 of The Glatisant! This newsletter is a free service put out by the Questing Beast YouTube channel.

New Releases & Upcoming Projects
Free Kriegsspiel Revolution
Interviews
Reviews
Worldbuilding
Theory
Random Tables

boardgame.name: Warp's Edge: Viren Invasion
Warp's Edge: Viren-Invasion
boardgame.description:
Taylor Minde's battles are far from over. More Viren forces have crawled out from the dark corners of the universe to threaten humanity once again. Will the Hive succeed in pollinating all planets? Will the Endless infest all systems with its infinite hordes? Only time will tell. But not all is doom and gloom! Taylor now has access to new skills and new starfighters with loadouts specially designed to combat the insectoid menace.

The Viren expansion is expanded content for Warp's Edge. It includes 6 new enemy cards, 3 new skill cards, 2 new Starfighter Play Boards and tokens, 3 energy tokens, and 2 new mothership dashboards and phasing tokens.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: At the Mercy of a Mad Mage
At the Mercy of a Mad Mage 4K
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Cinderella: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pumpkin? Check. Terrible sisters? Check. Prince Charming? Maybe … but not like you've ever seen before! Get ready for a Cinderella surprise as You Choose the path through three new versions of the classic fairy tale.

boardgame.name: The Little Mermaid: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've heard the tale of the little mermaid. But did you know that the mermaid was really a rock star? Or that the prince was burping under the sea? Be part of that world as you swim your way through three twisted takes on the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Jack and the Beanstalk: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Admit it―you've always wanted to know: WHAT was Jack thinking? Magic beans? Come on! Get into Jack's head―and the mother's, and the giant's!―as You Choose your path through three new versions of the famous fairy tale, with delightful (or disastrous!) consequences.

boardgame.name: Rapunzel: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rapunzel, Rapunzel, let down your...video game? Navigate your way through three different versions of the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path that leads to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Little Red Riding Hood: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a battle of wits, who will win? Little Red or the Wolf? The epic struggle between the two takes some unexpected twists in this fractured retelling of the beloved fairy tale. Who do you trust? What do you do? When You Choose the path through three new versions of this fairy tale, the consequences can be chilling, surprising, or disastrous.

boardgame.name: Beauty and the Beast: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's a tale as old as time. But what happens when Beauty is a real beast? Or when the prince is an android? Navigate your way through three twisted tales of the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: The Princess and the Pea: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ouch, my aching back! In this story, a tiny pea can be a big problem. Navigate your way through three twisted versions of the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Hansel and Gretel: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

How much do you really know about the story of Hansel and Gretel? Was the witch that bad, or was she just sick of kids eating her out of house and home? Did Hansel and Gretel leave a trail of breadcrumbs, or did they leave space beacons behind as they explored the galaxy in their spaceship? Find your way through three different versions of the classic fairy tale. In this story, YOU CHOOSE how it ends. Will you find your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: The Emperor's New Clothes: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The celebration is about to start. It's time to see the emperor's new...spacesuit? Join the party and go through three twisted versions of the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Goldilocks and the Three Bears: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We all know about Goldilocks and the three bears, but did you know that the little bear really runs the show? Or that Goldi was escaping from something worse than bears? Dive into this fairy tale twist, where You Choose the path through three different story lines and dozens of choices that will rewrite this classic tale.

boardgame.name: Rumpelstiltskin: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

James? Eddie? Freddy? Chris P. Bacon? In the ultimate name game between the miller's daughter and the little man behind the spinning wheel, it's anyone's guess who will win. Navigate through three fractured retellings of the classic fairy tale. In this story, YOU CHOOSE how it ends. Will you guess correctly and live happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know the story of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, or do you? Did you know Snow White was a secret agent? Or the seven dwarfs were really sled dogs in the arctic? Navigate through three different versions of the classic fairy tale. In this story, YOU CHOOSE how it ends. Will you get your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Sleeping Beauty: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wake up, Sleeping Beauty. Maleficent is on her way - and she's bringing aliens! Navigate through three twisted tales of the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: The Frog Prince: An Interactive Fairy Tale Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wondered how the prince became a frog? Find out what happened from the green guy himself. Or hear the fairy's side of the story. Hop your way through three twisted takes on the classic fairy tale. Will YOU CHOOSE the path to your happily ever after?

boardgame.name: Das Filmquiz: 666 Fragen zu Kino, Kult & Kassenschlagern
boardgame.description:
This is a simple box of trivia questions about films and everything regarding the film cosmos.
On each of the 111 cards are six categories for you to answer:

Stars
Quotes
Popcorn
Classics
Direction
Awards & Festivals


The category Popcorn consists of questions regarding goofs, adaptations, film music, voice actors, tech, technical terms and more.
Since there aren't any rules in the box, the game can be played as you like. The first one who reaches ten points wins? Why not. The first one to answer a question from each category correctly wins? Valid as well. As long as you have fun.

boardgame.name: 50 Abandoned Suburb Homes 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different residential homes that have been abandoned due to either an apocalypse or a zombie outbreak. Each piece of property is identified by the surname of the prior owner (examples: Miller Residence, Smith Place, Jones Property, etc.). In addition there are details regarding what kind of architectural style the home is, how many bedrooms and bathrooms, a random detail about the home or the property (including some potential encounters), and some ready to drop in loot items that the exploring survivors will find at this location. Feel free to add as many other bits of loot and information that you wish!

boardgame.name: 50 Abandoned Suburb Homes 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different residential homes that have been abandoned due to either an apocalypse or a zombie outbreak. Each piece of property is identified by the surname of the prior owner (examples: Miller Residence, Smith Place, Jones Property, etc.). In addition there are details regarding what kind of architectural style the home is, how many bedrooms and bathrooms, a random detail about the home or the property (including some potential encounters), and some ready to drop in loot items that the exploring survivors will find at this location. Feel free to add as many other bits of loot and information that you wish!

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 28
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 27
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 50 Hirelings 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventurers need hirelings… from traveling companions to camp defenders to folks working the fields back home. This 50 list offers a collection of such individuals who are ready for hire. Included in each entry is the following: first and last name, gender, role/occupation, active description, background description, and expected daily wages in copper or silver coins*.

boardgame.name: 50 Bikers 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different bikers to use with a variety of campaign genres including modern/crime, cyberpunk, grim near future, retro-modern, street level super hero, post apocalypse, zombie outbreak, modern horror, etc. Each entry includes the following: First (or Nick Name) and Last Name, Age, Gender, Brief Descriptive, Color and Model of Motorcycle, and the biker’s weapon(s) of choice.

boardgame.name: 50 Bikers 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different bikers to use with a variety of campaign genres including modern/crime, cyberpunk, grim near future, retro-modern, street level super hero, post apocalypse, zombie outbreak, modern horror, etc. Each entry includes the following: First (or Nick Name) and Last Name, Age, Gender, Brief Descriptive, Color and Model of Motorcycle, and the biker’s weapon(s) of choice.

boardgame.name: 100 1990s Era Bystanders 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 1990s Era Bystanders 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 1990s Era Bystanders 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: Home Canned Goods Roller
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So the survivors happen to come across a pantry that is full of mason jars containing homemade edibles. What sort of stuff was canned though? This roller product provides three charts to help you find that out. The first chart is the Quantity Chart– Rolling on it tells you what dice roll to further roll for number of jars found (such as 1d8). The second chart is the Jar Type Chart– Roll on it to find out what size of jars (such as quart). The third chart has 100 different types of goods that serve as contents (such as squash pickles).

boardgame.name: 50 Zombie Slayers 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 still living, breathing, and undead slaying survivors of a zombie outbreak. This product is perfect if you are trying to establish a safehouse group and you need an assortment of talents and personalities. Each entry contains the slayer’s name, their gender, their age, their major talent, a general descriptive, carried weapon(s), and some form of carried loot.

boardgame.name: Mint Tin Monster Mash
boardgame.description:
A royal rumble of epic proportions in a small package.

1 - 4 players will take some magnificent creature creations and battle them against each other. You must manage your energy reserves and mutate your creatures to survive. A simple but strategic dice rolling system will see you through to victory.....or defeat!

On a turn a player will Draw a Card and Receive an energy, then they may play any combo of two actions, play a monster, play a boost or receive an energy. After every three rounds players will battle their monsters in the arena.

The game ends when a player has defeated and collected three opponents monsters.

When you have vanquished your foes pack the game back up into it's tin and put it in your pocket!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Escale à Amiens
boardgame.description:
Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the city of Amiens from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have banknotes to practice all their activities.
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...

boardgame.name: SideLinks
boardgame.description:
SideLinks is a word association game all about conceptually connecting words found on adjacent cards. It can be described simply as a cross between Scrabble and Dominoes but with words.

The game contains 140 cards with 560 English words. Each card has four family-friendly words (one per edge) and a point value between 1 and 5. 1-point cards have words with the most connections (some with over 30), while 5-point cards have words with fewer connections. But don't worry, as well over 12,000 connections are known to be available!

There are a half a dozen ways to play the game.

Players compete to get the highest score by connecting related words. For example, TEACHER can be connected with STUDENT, SCHOOL, RESPECT, LEARNING, JOB as well as a dozen other words.

Hilarious dialog begins when someone attempts a dubious connection and has to “sell” it to the group. This makes it a game about connecting people.

Other ways to play include Match, Memory, Grid, Airplane Mode, Secret Connections and Team Secrets.

This family and party game is for use at home and school as well as corporate office team building.

SideLinks is the next version of the Connections card game, renamed for worldwide distribution as we only had the Canadian trademark for "Connections". It's a new standalone game with more cards, larger cards, some new rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood & Plunder: Raise the Black
boardgame.description:
This is all you need to start playing Blood & Plunder. Raise the Black will bring the Blood & Plunder universe to the 18th century and will include all new plastic kits and ships that will be fully customizable. The starter kit will be centered around the infamous encounter of Blackbeard Vs. Maynard. Everything needed to play will be included in the player 2 starter set, 2 forces , 2 legendary captains , dice, tokens, activation deck, movement templates, 2 sided player mat and more!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Blood & Plunder: No Peace Beyond the Line
Blood & Plunder: No Peace Beyond the Line

boardgame.name: Ruined Tomb of the Bound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A forest path takes you to a large gaping hole where a iron bound door once stood, the chamber within bearing an ancient seal. An altar sits silent, a tome containing the names those whom are buried within. You pass a shrine with a skeletal statue surrounded by partially melted candles.

Two tombs are in the corner of the chamber of the next chamber, one’s lid broken into and despoiled. Past the northern passage is an old living area with many broken small rooms that may have at one time contained beds for the keepers and a library with a demonic effigy.

To the south, lie two other chambers, a circular chamber, as well as a chamber with chains hanging from the ceiling, and two additional tombs. Deep with this complex, behind a damaged hidden door lies a secret lower crypt, containing a chest full with the treasures.

boardgame.name: Volcanic Master's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mountain path takes you above roiling magma to a large iron bound door, the chamber within bearing an ancient seal. An altar sits silent, a tome containing the names those whom once dwelt within it. You pass a shrine with a skeletal statue holding a fresh heart and candles illuminating the dark.

A feasting table is in this next chamber adjacent to a large pot of stew simmering on the fireplace, stores of food are stocked in the corner of the chamber. Past the northern passage is a living area with a table full of books, many small rooms containing beds and a library filled with a demonic red light.

To the south, a fissures flowing with lava runs through the lair. On the other side lie two other chambers, a circular chamber, as well as a chamber with torture devices, and prison cells. Deep with this complex, behind a broken hidden door lies a secret meeting room, crowned by a throne of bones.

boardgame.name: Assassins Master Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A forest path takes you to a large iron bound door, the chamber within bearing an ancient seal. An altar sits silent, a tome containing the names those whom once dwelt within it. You pass a shrine with a skeletal statue holding a fresh heart and candles illuminating the dark.

A feasting table is in this next chamber adjacent to a large pot of stew simmering on the fireplace, stores of food are stocked in the corner of the chamber. Past the northern passage is a living area with a table full of books, many small rooms containing beds and a library filled with a demonic red light.

To the south, lie two other chambers, a circular chamber containing weapons and practice dummies, as well as a chamber with torture devices, and prison cells. Deep with this complex, behind a hidden door lies a secret meeting room, crowned by a throne of bones.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Bridges
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains. Poorly constructed wooden bridges have been made to bridge the gaps between the stony chasms and large conifer trees and bushes of flowering plants covering the ground. In the corner of the rocky escarpment lies an entrance to a dark cavern.

boardgame.name: Snowy Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The snowy rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains leaving stony chasms, large conifer trees and bushes of flowering plants covering the ground. In the corner of the rocky escarpment lies an entrance to a dark cavern.

boardgame.name: Starlit Abode of the Ratmen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The moon shines down on the rocks in this area that have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains. Poorly constructed wooden bridges have been made to bridge the gaps between the stony chasms and dreary dying trees and fetid plants cover the ground.

Strange mechanical devices and pipes jut from the rocks and leak bright green toxic liquid and an entrance to a dark cavern lies at the center of this encampment.

boardgame.name: Belkrig's Bridges
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains. Poorly constructed wooden bridges have been made to bridge the gaps between the stony chasms and dreary dying trees and fetid plants cover the ground. In the corner of the rocky escarpment lies an entrance to a dark cavern.

boardgame.name: Dismal Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains leaving stony chasms, dreary dying trees and fetid plants covering the ground. Strange bones are scattered among the rubble and an entrance to a dark cavern lies at the center of this boneyard.

boardgame.name: Snowy Excavation Ambush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The snowy rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains leaving stony chasms, large conifer trees and bushes of flowering plants covering the ground.

However, the bodies of multiple miners lie bloodied and broken among an empty mine cart and an entrance to a dark mine shaft lies at the center.

boardgame.name: Ambush at the Mines
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains leaving stony chasms, large conifer trees and bushes of flowering plants covering the ground.

However, the bodies of multiple miners lie bloodied and broken among an empty mine cart and an entrance to a dark mine shaft lies at the center.

boardgame.name: Volcanic Ashlands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the churning magma which run through the mountains Poorly constructed wooden bridges have been made to bridge the gaps between the volcanic chasms, and burnt black stone.

Obsidian pieces are scattered among the rubble and an entrance to a dark cavern lies at the center of this hellscape.

boardgame.name: Abode of the Ratmen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rocks in this area have been carved away overtime by the streams which run through the mountains. Poorly constructed wooden bridges have been made to bridge the gaps between the stony chasms and dreary dying trees and fetid plants cover the ground.

Strange mechanical devices and pipes jut from the rocks and leak bright green toxic liquid and an entrance to a dark cavern lies at the center of this encampment.

Adventure Seed

A remote village has been affected by a plague that leaves its inhabitants with patchy fur and yellow, ridged claws instead of fingernails. Babies are born with pink tails and heads like rodents, only to be killed by their own mothers. Those who have let them live have suffered from vicious attacks, for the children are not just hideous, but mindless and aggressive.

Now, adults are beginning to lose their memories as well, becoming something different and unrecognizable. It starts with hoarding shiny objects and twitching, before quickly escalating to paranoia and rampant aggression. The worst of them burrow into the soil and seem sensitive to light; coming out at night and hunting the remaining villagers for their worthless, yet reflective, possessions. In this way many friends have had to kill those they once knew to survive.

What’s happening? A magical contaminant has been flowing downstream in the water (if your players have drunk any they may start changing). Bandits have created a mine and refinery for this valuable, green substance upstream, and, due to the danger, are using kidnapped prisoners to dig it out of the underground veins.

The prisoners don’t live long and are usually killed in two weeks due to the rapid changes, unbeknownst to the other captives. The bandits lie to the survivors, telling them that those who are gone have been freed to return to their families. Because they are not entirely heartless, everyone must work a shift of two weeks, before they can leave. This, they claim, is why they have a constant influx of new slaves.

boardgame.name: Empowered Obelisks of Zarn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The dreary forested woodlands give way to a large ravine where frigid waters meet after rush down the rocky cliff side meeting a muddy bank full of bones. Thick vines have grown around rocks creating a small bridge to the other side where a path leads towards a small altar. The altar is surrounded by two other small streams and sits at the highest point on the rock it was built on.

Below the altar are five trinkets made from skulls and carved wood corresponding to the four large obelisks that surround the area as well as the shrine itself where magical energy swirl and pulsates with power. Within this opening in the wilds you can marvel at the stars which shine above.

boardgame.name: Starlit Obelisks of Zarn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The dreary forested woodlands give way to a large ravine where frigid waters meet after rush down the rocky cliff side meeting a muddy bank full of bones. Thick vines have grown around rocks creating a small bridge to the other side where a path leads towards a small altar. The altar is surrounded by two other small streams and sits at the highest point on the rock it was built on.

Below the altar are five trinkets made from skulls and carved wood corresponding to the four large obelisks that surround the area as well as the shrine itself. Within this opening in the wilds you can marvel at the stars which shine above.

boardgame.name: Corporation Overview Maker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A corporation is defined as "a large company or group of companies authorized to act as a single entity and recognized as such in law." But in games and stories, they are often more than that. They can be giant overruling entities who have their metaphorical fingers in every pie, controlling ever aspect of everyday life, from politics to communications to even the local government and military!

This is especially true in certain genres of science fiction, like cyberpunk, where they make excellent "villains" and antagonists against which the characters of the story are, in their way, fighting against. And this PDF can help to give you an outline on them, something to build on and add your individual details too.

boardgame.name: De Boca en Boca
boardgame.description:
Be the first one to complete your start !
De Boca en Boca is a Trivia Game with questions about one of Argentina's Greatest Soccer Team.
Pick questions among 5 themes:

History
Half plus one
campaigns
who's who
potpourri

boardgame.name: The Headless Woman
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Pride has been the downfall of many people throughout the ages. Among the most terrible stories of those whose pride has laid them low is that of Anne-Louise Bellerose, Baroness de Tournay.

boardgame.name: Avanti
boardgame.description:
Avanti is played on a 8x8 grid. Each player has 16 plastic cylinders on the rows nearest them, but one is in their opponent's color and one has a pawn standing on top. The object of the game is to get your pawn to your piece that starts on your opponent's side of the board, but it can only move on the cylinders.

The cylinders move by jumping over one or more cylinders of the same color, and an opposing cylinder at the end of a line can be captured by landing on it. You can also move the opposing goal cylinder on your side of the board.

boardgame.name: Ajax competitiespel
boardgame.description:
Ajax competitiespel is played on a board representing a football pitch with the famous 4-3-3 Ajax formation.
The goal is to be the first one to assemble the complete team on the board, as well as a trainer:

4 defenders
3 midfielders
3 attackers
1 keeper
1 trainer


3000 (easy to hard) questions about the Ajax Amsterdam.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2020
boardgame.description:
Promo tile given out by Hans im Glück in 2020.

No specific rules are included with the tile. The tile is simply mixed with the other landscape tiles. When a player draws the tile, he or she should place the tile according to the usual rules.

boardgame.name: Embrace Your Happiness
행복챙김
boardgame.description:
Embrace Your Happiness is a board game that helps you explore the happiness of yourself and others through a game.
When you know when you’re happy and how you feel when you’re happy, you won’t just wait for it, but you would actively pursue your happiness.
I invite you to this wonderful experience of discovering the happiness of you and others through Embrace your happiness.

Components are all Cards, 50 "Happiness plug" cards, 40 "Happiness on" cards, 12 "you and me" cards, 6 "you're the one" cards, 6 "help me" cards, 20 "Happiness phrase" cards, and 100 sheets.

There are two types of gameplay. The first one is the deduction game. It's a game that players guess when other players feel happy by asking questions.
Drafting "Happiness plug" cards should be three in each player's hand and all "Happiness on" cards should be open and placed on the table can see. Each player put one of their "Happiness plug" cards on the table and choose the one "Happiness on" card. After choosing the "Happiness on" card, shuffle the "Happiness plug" cards that on the table and flip all cards, and placed like a Dixit.
All players can ask the other players with their "Happiness on" card. The question should be yes or no. Only have one opportunity to ask a question. After this conversation, all players start to guess and write the name and "Happiness plug" card with matching. For every correct guess a player made, get 3 points. After 3 rounds, the game is finished. The player who got the highest point will be a winner.

The second gameplay is storytelling. It's a game that players suggest to other players the best way for them to regain the happiness they've been missing recently.
All player chooses two of the "Happiness on" cards and places the front of the player. Make a pile of "Happiness plug" cards and open the top 8 cards on the table. The start player begins to talk about their bad feeling situation with one of the "Happiness on" card. After finish the talk, the others start to give a solution with one of the "Happiness plug" cards. After all players' suggestions finished, the start player chooses the best suggestion and gives the "help me" card to the player who gives the best solution and that card is going to be 3 points. When every player gives the "help me" card to another player, the game is done. The player who has the highest score will be a winner.

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for the Dreadnaught
boardgame.description:
Take to the high seas of Middle-earth with The Hunt for the Dreadnaught, a unique scenario pack for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! Rumors have reached your ears of the deadly Corsairs of Umbar. The whispers say that the Corsairs have completed the construction of the monstrous Dreadnaught, and this powerful warship now roams the coasts. Only Middle-earth’s bravest heroes have a chance to find and sink the Dreadnaught.

This scenario pack contains a full new standalone scenario, challenging you and your fellow heroes with a maritime adventure. You can play this scenario normally, with a single group of one to four players, or you can challenge the full might of the Dreadnaught in Epic Multiplayer Mode with multiple groups of players. Will you liberate the oceans of Middle-earth from the depredations of the Corsairs?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

boardgame.name: Get to da Checkpoint
Get to da Choppa!
boardgame.description:
The Story so Far…

Your squad of Special Ops soldiers has been sent on a Top Secret mission to a remote part of South America. Before you can reach your Landing Zone, your chopper crashes, many kilometers away from your destination. Salvaging what you can from the wreckage, armed with a GPS uplink, your wits and weapons, you must fight your way through an unknown and hostile jungle. Your only possibility for survival:
Get to da Choppa!

About the Game-

Get to da Choppa! is a solo dice game that’s free to print and play.

Your goal is to get your Squad through several areas (called Zones) of the wild jungles of South America. However, this area of the jungle has fallen victim to a number of hostile forces. Drug Lords, UFOs, invisible alien hunters, Nazis, zombies, headhunters, dinosaurs; any jungle action movie trope you can think of you’ll have to face and try to survive. You will need to balance moving, stealth, foraging for supplies and combat to survive. The only way to win is to Get to da Choppa before your squad is wiped out.

Each turn, you roll nine dice and can re-roll and keep any dice you like up three total rolls. You place the dice on your Squad sheet to follow the turn's order and show how many dice you have placed to a certain activity that turn. Here’s a breakdown of where all the dice rolled are placed, and what they mean.

Enemy Contact- Your Squad encounters an obstacle or enemy that needs to be dealt with.
Salvage- Some of your Squad forages for supplies and ammo.
March- Your Squad moves along your path towards the next Check Point.
Stealth- Your Squad attempts to move slowly and avoid detection from an Enemy Contact.
Engage- Your Squad readies for combat! Lock and Load!
Command- Can be used as an additional die during each of the Salvage, March, Stealth and Combat phases. They can also be used to re-roll any single die on the Salvage, Combat, Injury, Recovery or Supply Shortage tables.


The drama of the story unfolds by balancing the lives of your squad with the risks and combat you are willing to get into, as well as ensuring enough resources. Each turn brings you closer to the next checkpoint, where you will need to rest, restock, and heal up. The game ends by reaching the fourth Zone's Checkpoint where the extraction Chopper is waiting to take what's left of your squad back to safety. Victory conditions are calculated by a simple number of Squad members survived, or a slightly more involved scoring system.

—description from the designer

Results of the 2020 Solo PnP Design Contest for Get to da Choppa!

Best Overall Game: 19th
Best Easy to Build Game: 9th
Best Original Artwork: 10th
Best Game Designed in Contest Timeframe: 5th
Best New Solitaire Designer: 8th
Best Push Your Luck/Survival: 3rd

boardgame.name: The Down Mail
boardgame.description:
Roll and move your train through a number of stations and signal points and complete the journey before the other players.

A beautiful example of a basic game from the early 20th century.

boardgame.name: Hojo Pojo
boardgame.description:
Hojo Pojo is a deliciously-fun, family-friendly hot pot themed card game that plays up to a party of 6.

The objective of the game is to cook and eat as much food as you can before the dipping sauce runs out. The player with the most number of points wins, BUT if another player reveals the King of the Pot card at the end of the game, a final eat off will be conducted to determine the ultimate winner!

The gameplay simulates the actual eating of hot pot. You will need Tongs or Slotted Ladle to cook ingredients, and Bowls to contain the cooked ingredients. You get to roll the dice for each bowl card played in front of you. If you manage to roll a matching colour with an ingredient in the cooked area, dip it into a sauce before you eat by picking a Sauce Card, and yum!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Splendor: Greater China Tournament Prize Coins
boardgame.description: Set of five metal coins to replace the gold tokens.

boardgame.name: World Adventure: Ancient Runes
boardgame.description:
World Adventure: Ancient Runes is an expandable 1-4 players turn-based strategic fantasy board game. In this game, you’ll compete against other Dark World Stone Keepers while collecting as many as Ancient Runes.

First player who has succeeded acquiring number of Ancient Runes will be the winner. Along the way, you must withstand monsters and other heroes which appeal to your attack, heal, buff, and de-buff skills.

In this episode, you will be brought into The Silk Road, which has some similarities with our current world besides its own supranatural and fantasy approach. This world bustles around Europe and Asia which were famous with valuable goods, such as silk, medicines, spices, metals, and foods.

Our game is inspired by other fantastic board game such as Merchant & Marauders, Scythe, and Zombicide. The storyline is influenced by novels and console games such as Sword Art Online, Log Horizon, Grimgar, Suikoden, Vandal Hearts, and Final Fantasy.

Games Feature:

Appealing Theme with Meeple Artwork
Multiple modern world heroes are summoned as Dark World Stone Keepers. Through Meeple Artwork, we strive our best to design custom artworks. It has one-of-a-kind mechanism which hero could be attached to various caravan and pets. All of these come in laser-cut finishing and great quality material.

Free Play
Privilege to build what kind of player you are. Win the game by being yourself!

Custom Game Plan
Start the game by choosing hero, caravan, and soldiers. Then infuse different skills to thrive Explorer, Charisma, or Leadership. Earn money to upgrade your caravan, purchase items, or strengthen your soldiers.

Multi In-Game Concept (America Games and Euro Games)
Be a Monster Hunter or Bandit if you prefer more challenges which will give you more gains. Be a Merchant or Warlord if you prefer winning the game through trading and vast business.

Rival or Semi Co-op
World Adventure: The Silk Road could be played by 2-4 people in a competitive or semi-cooperative mode that requires teamwork and strategy.

Solo Mode
World Adventure: Ancient Runes could be played in Solo Mode, with some achievements that you can share with other players. This mode also gives you some practices before taking a battle with other players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fröccs
boardgame.description:
Who sells the finest spritzer in the corner pub? And who manages to make their drinks with the best quality wine? Buy glasses, collect cards, and hope that the others do not spill your sparkling soda, or absorb your wine with 'greasy bread' (a typical rural Hungarian dish)…
You may bargain with them if such a card is played on you! But even if you don’t allow yourself to be bullied, you can still improve the situation with your characters: 'Böske, the Terrible' or 'Gargoyle Karesz' can always help bring your plans to fruition!

Fröccs is a fun and interactive board game where you earn Forints based on the quality and quantity of the spritzers you mix and sell. Play as many cards as the glasses in front of you to fill them with wine and sparkling soda, or to impede your competition with action cards.
